definition: to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver

sentences.english: I couldn't believe my ears. Had I heard right?
sentences.chinese: 我不敢相信自己的耳朵，我没听错么？

sentences.english: Yes, you heard right. She tells stories through sand.
sentences.chinese: 对了，你没听错，她的确会用沙子讲述一个个故事。

sentences.english: But, is a cold rain Mo to listen to erroneous?
sentences.chinese: 可是，难道是寒雨墨听错了？
他们假装听错了我的话。

sentences.english: You frequently mishear the things that people say.
sentences.chinese: 你经常把别人说的话听错。

sentences.english: I am afraid I misheard my teacher.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我听错了老师的话。

sentences.english: Maybe I'm listening to the wrong stations.
And you heard right, that makes Irish-Americans the second largest ancestral group in the U. S.
sentences.chinese: 你没听错，爱尔兰裔是美国的第二大祖籍源地。
是的，你没有听错，是中微子。

sentences.english: Maybe he misheard you? Otherwise, WOW, that guy is a dick.
sentences.chinese: 可能他听错了？不然，这家伙是个混蛋。

definition: to err/to get sth wrong/to miscalculate/to misunderstand
to misinterpret what one sees or reads/to misjudge (sb)/to mistake (sb for sb else)/to misread (a document)
to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)
to look distracted/to stare blankly/distracted/blank/(coll.) unexpectedly/rash/rashly
to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
